intro: Orlaya vilnensis, commonly known as the Vilnius orlaya, is a flowering plant native to eastern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its delicate, branched stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and along riverbanks, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in late summer. Orlaya vilnensis is often found in wetland habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
